item.title: 佐科维的新部长们承诺增加石油产量和投资
item.description: 总统佐科-维多多（Joko Widodo）的新部长们旨在制定政策，在本届政府执政的最后两个月后提高石油和天然气产量，并吸引更多私营部门投资。【原文：President Joko Widodo’s new ministers aim to set down policies that will boost oil and gas output as well as attract more private sector investment beyond the current administration’s last two months in power.】

item.title: 尼日尔在输油管道重新开放后恢复通过贝宁出口石油
item.description: 尼日尔政府官员表示，在与邻国贝宁达成一项协议后，尼日尔将恢复石油出口。【原文：Niger is resuming oil exports after reaching an agreement with neighboring Benin following a recent border spat, government officials said.】

item.title: 高盛策略师称 2025 年美国销售额预测过高
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Corporate America’s expectations for sales next year are too high given the outlook for a moderating economy and weaker dollar, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists.】

item.title: 埃及延长央行行长任期以示政策连续性
item.description: 埃及将哈桑-阿卜杜拉（Hassan Abdalla）对央行的领导权再延长一年，此举可能会让投资者放心，在今年早些时候大幅加息和货币贬值之后，这个北非国家将继续奉行正统的货币政策。【原文：Egypt extended Hassan Abdalla’s leadership of the central bank by another year, a move that may reassure investors the North African nation is committed to orthodox monetary policies after a dramatic interest-rate hike and currency devaluation earlier this year.】

item.title: 德国计划控制乌克兰开支，国防股下跌
item.description: 据报道，德国将不再批准向乌克兰提供援助的新请求，以努力控制支出，欧洲国防类股周一下滑，削减了今年迄今为止的一些大涨幅。【原文：European defense stocks slid on Monday, paring some big year-to-date gains, after a report that Germany will no longer grant new requests for aid to Ukraine in an effort to rein in spending.】

item.title: 内特-西尔弗和玛丽亚-科尼科娃谈选举投注的艺术
item.description:
预测市场到底有什么用？【原文：

What good are prediction markets anyway?

】

item.title: 今冬英国能源账单将因天然气价格上涨而上涨
item.description: 由于全球天然气供应面临风险，天然气成本飙升，整个冬季英国的能源账单都将增加。【原文：UK energy bills are poised to increase through the winter, as the cost of natural gas has jumped because of risks to supplies around the world.】

item.title: 联邦银行称存款增长是印度贷款机构面临的首要问题
item.description: 联邦银行（Federal Bank Ltd）零售业务主管沙利尼-瓦里耶（Shalini Warrier）表示，随着客户选择的投资方式日益多样化，存款增长成为印度银行业面临的最大挑战。【原文：Deposit growth is the Indian banking sector’s biggest challenge as customers choose from an increasingly diverse range of investment alternatives, according to Shalini Warrier, retail business head at Federal Bank Ltd.】

item.title: 下滑的比特币难以驾驭全球风险偏好的反弹
item.description: 尽管全球股市在摆脱对美国经济增长的恐慌后又向纪录高点挺进，但本月迄今为止，比特币和更广泛的加密货币市场仍在遭受大幅损失。【原文：Bitcoin and the wider crypto market are nursing sharp losses for the month so far even as global stocks push back toward record highs after shaking off a growth scare over the US economy.】

item.title: 欧洲天然气市场下滑，因为强劲的流量和库存缓解了风险
item.description: 欧洲天然气价格下跌，因为俄罗斯燃料继续通过乌克兰输送，而且更多替代供应品运抵欧洲大陆。【原文：European natural gas prices declined as Russian fuel keeps flowing via Ukraine and more alternative supplies arrive on the continent.】

item.title: 欧洲股市在 5 月以来涨幅最大的一周后止跌回升
item.description: 继上周大幅反弹之后，欧洲股市周一开盘表现低迷，投资者在等待美联储杰克逊霍尔经济研讨会提供有关美国经济的进一步线索。【原文：European stocks marked a subdued start to Monday following last week’s sharp rally, as investors awaited further clues on the US economy from the Federal Reserve’s Jackson Hole economic symposium.】

item.title: 阿达尼集团利用现金储备缓解对兴登堡的担忧
item.description: 阿达尼集团（Adani Group）表示，其现金足以支付 30 多个月的债务，此举旨在减轻人们对其流动性风险的担忧，因为这家印度企业集团正在考虑为其旗舰部门重新筹资。【原文：Adani Group said it has enough cash to cover more than 30 months of debt payments, in a move aimed at alleviating concerns about its liquidity risk as the Indian conglomerate contemplates fresh fundraising for its flagship unit.】

item.title: 英国与 DP World 合作建设刚果首个深海港
item.description: DP World 和英国政府的发展融资机构将在刚果民主共和国破土动工建设一个深海港，以扩大这家酋长国物流公司在非洲的扩张。【原文：DP World and the British government’s development-finance arm will break ground on a deep-sea port in the Democratic Republic of Congo as the Emirate logistics company broadens its expansion in Africa.】

item.title: 中美合作成立联络小组应对 "金融压力
item.description: 中国央行表示，在上海举行的一次会议上，中国央行与美国财政部达成了一项协议，双方将指定联系人来应对未来的任何 "金融压力事件"，这是世界上两个最大经济体寻求共识的一个罕见例子。【原文：China’s central bank said a meeting in Shanghai produced an agreement with the US Treasury to appoint contact people to deal with any future “financial stress events,” a rare example of the world’s two biggest economies seeking common ground.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚寻求加大生物柴油混合比例以减少化石燃料使用量
item.description: 印度尼西亚正在寻求在柴油中掺入更多的棕榈油，以减少化石燃料的使用，这一雄心勃勃的目标增加了热带油料供应紧缩的风险。【原文：Indonesia is seeking to blend more palm oil with diesel to cut its use of fossil fuels, with the ambitious target raising the risk of tightening supply of the tropical oil.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：股市将迎来全球大跌以来的首次连跌
item.description: 2024 年 8 月 12 日星期一，英国伦敦金融城的上班族。英国央行正在仔细研究劳动力市场数据，以确定经济中徘徊的通胀力量的强度。摄影师：何塞-萨门托-马托斯/布鲁姆伯格【原文：Commuters in the City of London, UK, on Monday, Aug. 12, 2024. The Bank of England is looking carefully at labor market data to determine the strength of inflationary forces lingering in the economy. Photographer: Jose Sarmento Matos/Bloomberg】

item.title: 欧洲为债券销售回升做好准备 结束夏季放缓趋势
item.description: 银行家和借款人都在为本周的债券销售做好准备，希望趁市场平静时达成交易。【原文：Bankers and borrowers are getting ready for bond sales to pick up this week, looking to secure deals while markets are calm.】

item.title: 尼克松的幽灵是 74 年的通货膨胀，而不是 68 年的芝加哥
item.description:
风城的民主党人和杰克逊霍尔的央行行长都对半个世纪前的反通胀失败耿耿于怀。【原文：

Democrats in the Windy City and central bankers in Jackson Hole are haunted by the anti-inflation failures of half a century ago.

】

item.title: 罗滕巴赫寻求退休，Absa 任命罗森为临时首席执行官
item.description: 由于现任首席执行官罗滕巴赫（Arrie Rautenbach）寻求提前退休，南非第三大银行 Absa Group Ltd. 任命查尔斯-罗森（Charles Russon）为临时首席执行官。【原文：Absa Group Ltd., South Africa’s third-biggest bank by assets, named Charles Russon as interim chief executive officer as incumbent Arrie Rautenbach sought early retirement.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 世界如何梦游般地陷入全球麻风病紧急状况
item.description: 一种变异的麻风腮病毒已在刚果民主共和国流行数月之久。现在，应对这一全球卫生紧急事件的工作面临着一个关键障碍：该国仍然没有一种疫苗。【原文：A mutated form of mpox has been circulating in the Democratic Republic of Congo for months. Now the response to what has become a global health emergency faces a key obstacle: The country still doesn’t have a single vaccine.】

item.title: 利率将维持在 50%，土耳其经济难有喘息之机
item.description: 土耳其央行可能将连续第五个月按兵不动，重点将转向流动性管理和经济增长放缓的明显迹象。【原文：Turkey’s central bank will probably leave its main interest-rate on hold for a fifth straight month, with the focus shifting to liquidity management and visible signs of a slowdown in economic growth.】

item.title: 日元对美元汇率跳升 1%，因美元汇率普遍走软
item.description: 在央行高官本周发表评论之前，日元兑美元反弹，在十国集团货币中涨幅居前。【原文：The yen rallies against the dollar, leading gains among Group-of-10 currencies before comments from top central bank officials this week.】

item.title: 科技股反弹，高额对冲成本表明怀疑态度
item.description: 最近美国科技股的反弹还不能让期权交易商信服。【原文：The recent rebound in US tech stocks isn’t convincing options traders just yet.】

item.title: 激进分子在 1987 年以来最严重的股市下跌期间买入日本股票
item.description: 激进投资者利用本月早些时候日本股市暴跌的机会增持股票，寻求对从制药商到建筑公司等各类公司施加更多影响。【原文：Activist investors took advantage of Japan’s stock rout earlier this month to boost their holdings, seeking more influence over companies ranging from drug makers to construction firms.】

item.title: 非洲可可收成可能会提高，但您的巧克力价格不会提高
item.description:
挑战包括疾病、气候变化和农民报酬低。【原文：

Challenges include disease, climate change and low farmer pay.

】

item.title: 大宗商品繁荣期即将结束
item.description:
在沐浴价格上涨的阳光之后，铁矿石面临暴风雪。【原文：

After basking in the sunshine of higher prices, iron ore faces a blizzard. 

】

item.title: 本地需求回升，中国铜出口从创纪录水平回落
item.description: 由于国内买家利用金属价格迅速回落的机会，中国上个月的铜出口量从历史最高点回落。【原文：Chinese copper exports dropped last month from an all-time high, as domestic buyers took advantage of the metal’s rapid retreat in price.】

item.title: Nifty 指数能否突破 25 011 点的历史高点？
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 泰国新总理有望本周结束内阁会谈
item.description: 泰国新任总理白通丹-西那瓦（Paetongtarn Shinawatra）在获得皇室批准成为泰国最年轻的领导人一天后表示，她预计本周将结束与联盟各党就内阁组成的谈判。【原文：Thailand’s new Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said she expects to wrap up talks with her coalition parties this week about the make-up of her cabinet, a day after securing royal endorsement to become the country’s youngest leader.】
